channel.title: What is OHI on Ocean Health Index
channel.description: Recent content in What is OHI on Ocean Health Index

item.title: Contact
item.description: Contact OHI For all inquiries about the OHI, contact lead analyst Gage Clawson at sgclawson@bren.ucsb.edu Press Resources Press Kit Logo

item.title: People
item.description: This team develops scientific methods, communicates results to governments, marine managers, scientists and the public, manages current operations and directs future development of the Ocean Health Index project. Ben Halpern has been with the project since planning began in 2008. The team gratefully acknowledges the individuals, foundations, organizations and corporations listed as Contributors and Sustaining Partners. This project would not exist without them. Ben Halpern Lead Scientist Melanie Frazier

item.title: Publications
item.description: Peer-reviewed publications by the OHI team; * indicates open access. OHI assessments Global website with all data and supplementary methods Halpern et al. 2017, PLoS ONE*. Drivers and implications of change in global ocean health over the past 5 years. (website with interactive figures and maps) Halpern et al. 2015, PLoS ONE*. Patterns and emerging trends in global ocean health. (2013 and updated 2012 global data) Halpern et al. 2012, Nature.

item.title: Supporters
item.description: We are grateful for the generous support from the Pacific Life Foundation and the Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation, as well as our founding contributors for helping us build the Ocean Health Index from the beginning. Without their generosity of intellectual and financial support the Ocean Health Index would not be a reality. The Pacific Life Foundation The Pacific Life Foundation made a commitment in 2011 to become the Founding Presenting Sponsor of the Ocean Health Index.
